**Critical Success** The target takes 10d8 [void](link_trait_1485) damage. If the target is [technological](link_trait_3677), it instead takes 4d6 persistent [acid](link_trait_1528) damage and is glitching 2 and stunned 1.

**Success** The target takes 5d8 [void](link_trait_1485) damage. If the target is [technological](link_trait_3677), it instead takes 2d6 persistent [acid](link_trait_1528) damage and is glitching 1.

text.text: The initial damage increases by 1d8, and the persistent damage increases by 1d6.

name: Wave of Warning
targets: 1 creature, plus any number of additional creatures
description:
This spell was developed by maraquoi spellcasters to deter enemies with a wave of mental determination, and they use it to great effect. The spell deals 7d8 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage, and the target must attempt a Will save. The psychic energy then arcs to another creature within 30 feet of the first target, jumps to another creature within 30 feet of that target, and so on. You can end the wave at any point. You can’t target the same creature more than once, and you must have line of effect to all targets. Roll the damage only once and apply it to each target (halving or doubling as appropriate for its saving throw outcome).

**Critical Success** The target creature is unaffected, and the wave ends with that target.

**Success** The target takes half damage.

**Failure** The target takes full damage and is frightened 1.

**Critical Failure** The target takes double damage and is frightened 2.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d8.

name: Event Horizon
description:
You unleash the power of a supermassive black hole. All creatures in the area take 6d10 bludgeoning and 6d10 [void](link_trait_1485) damage. Treat the resistances of creatures in the area as if they were 10 lower for the purpose of determining the event horizon’s damage. Each creature attempts a Reflex save.

**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

**Success** The creature takes half damage and is stunned 1.

**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is stunned 2 and slowed 1 for 1 minute.

**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is stunned 3 and slowed 2 for 1 minute.

name: Explosion of Rot
description:
A giant pustule swells and explodes, coating everything around it in life-draining rot. Creatures in the area take 6d6 [poison](link_trait_1476) damage and must attempt a basic Reflex save. Foliage and plant matter in the area no longer counts as cover after this spell affects it.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target takes half damage.

**Failure** The target takes full damage and is enfeebled 1.

**Critical Failure** The target takes double damage, 1d6 persistent [poison](link_trait_1476) damage, and is enfeebled 2.

text.text: The initial damage increases by 2d6, and the persistent damage increases by 1d6.

name: Singularity Seed
description:
A tiny particle of incredibly dense mass [magically](link_trait_1504) blossoms into a gravitational singularity. You create a singularity in a 5-foot square that is unoccupied by any creatures. All creatures and unsecured objects in the area are moved toward the singularity when the spell is [cast](link_action_19611), at the end of their turn, and whenever they use an action to move within the area, all depending on their Reflex saving throws. This follows the rules for forced movement. If there’s not enough space near the center of the singularity, creatures and objects nearer to the center move first, and others move as far as they can without being blocked, up to the amount set by their saving throw outcomes. A creature within the area of the spell reduces its Speed by half when moving away from the singularity, but can move double its Speed when moving toward it

A creature or object that enters or starts their turn in the square containing the singularity takes 10d10 [void](link_trait_1485) damage. A creature in the singularity can take no actions except an Athletics check against your spell DC to [Escape](link_action_19632) the singularity. If a creature was moved into the singularity when it attempted to use a move action and [Escapes](link_action_19632) on the same turn, it can complete the movement without spending an action or attempting an additional Reflex saving throw. Multiple creatures can occupy the square containing the singularity, as they’re considered to be in an [extradimensional](link_trait_1559) space. When the spell ends, the singularity disappears, and creatures and objects that were sucked into the singularity appear in the space where you conjured it (or as close as possible to that space, if they can’t all fit within it). When the spell is [cast](link_action_19611), or when creatures move within the area, or end their turn within the area, targets must attempt a Reflex save.

**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

**Success** The creature moves 10 feet toward the center.

**Failure** The creature moves 20 feet toward the center.

**Critical Failure** The creature moves 30 feet toward the center

name: Feline Senses
description: The target’s senses improve as it gains feline eyes, ears, and whiskers. The target gains [darkvision](link_sense_20769) and [scent (imprecise, 30 feet)](link_sense_20773). If the target already had [darkvision](link_sense_20769), it gains electromagnetic sense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet, allowing it to detect living and technological creatures. If the target already had [scent](link_sense_20773), it can double the distance of one of these senses.

text.text: The number of targets increases by 1.

name: Weight of Ages
description:
You burden a creature with all the aches, pains, and sorrows of a lifetime in a condensed bolt. Make a ranged spell attack roll. The bolt deals 6d8 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage and the target is encumbered.

**Critical Success** The target takes 12d8 damage and is encumbered for 1 minute.

**Success** The target takes 6d8 damage and is encumbered for 1 round.

name: Flashfire
description: You cause fires to ignite and spread. This deals 3d6 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage to each creature that’s in the area when the spell is cast or that ends its turn in the area (basic Reflex save). A creature who critically fails its saving throw also takes 4 persistent [fire](link_trait_1542) damage. The area is hazardous terrain. A creature who moves on the ground through the area takes 4 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage for every square of that area it moves into. Everything on each side of the flashfire is concealed from creatures on the opposite side. Each time you [sustain](link_action_19858) this spell, the radius of the [fire](link_trait_1542) increases by 5 feet.

text.text: The [fire](link_trait_1542) damage increases by 1d6. The persistent damage increases by 1, and the hazardous terrain damage increases by 1

name: Genetic Regeneration
description:
You imbue the target’s genetic code with a stimulating regenerative property that begins healing its wounds. The target temporarily gains regeneration 8, which restores 8 Hit Points to it at the start of each of its turn. While it has regeneration, the target can’t die from taking damage, and its dying condition can’t increase to a value that would kill it (this stops most creatures’ dying condition at dying 3), though if its wounded value becomes 4 or higher, it stays unconscious until its wounds are treated. If the target takes [acid](link_trait_1528) or [fire](link_trait_1542) damage, its regeneration deactivates until after the end of its next turn.

Once during the spell’s duration, the creature can forgo healing Hit Points that round to regrow one damaged or ruined organ or reattach a severed body part by spending an [Interact](link_action_19733) action to hold the body part to the area it was severed from.

text.text: Increase the regeneration value by 2.

name: Glow Up
description:
You create an [illusion](link_trait_1447) that causes the target to appear more charming and genteel to observers. The spell accentuates the target’s appearance, clothing, voice, and mannerisms according to what an observer finds appealing. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item removed from the creature returns to its true appearance.

Casting glow up grants the target a +1 status bonus to Diplomacy checks to [Make an Impression](link_action_19739), and lets the target add its level to Diplomacy checks if untrained. In addition, the target can attempt a Diplomacy check to [Gather Information](link_action_19723) in only 10 minutes. You can [Dismiss](link_action_19627) this spell.

text.text: The bonus increases by 1, to a maximum of +4 at 7th rank.

name: Gravity Field
description:
You increase the forces of gravity in an area. All flying creatures in the area descend 40 feet. The entire area is greater difficult terrain for Flying creatures, and difficult terrain for creatures on the ground. Any creature that ends its turn Flying within the area descends 20 feet. Any creature pulled to the ground by a _gravity field_ takes bludgeoning damage as though it had fallen.

Gravity in the area increases by one step (for example, zero-g becomes low gravity, low gravity becomes standard, standard gravity becomes high gravity, and high gravity becomes extreme gravity).

name: Gravity Tether
description: You manipulate the electromagnetic forces acting on a creature. Make a ranged spell attack. The target takes 4d8 [electricity](link_trait_1576) damage and is pulled 5 feet closer to you, or 10 feet closer on a critical hit. Moving the target into a barrier, creature, or obstacle causes the target to stop before entering that space.

text.text: Make a ranged spell attack roll against up to two target creatures. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but it doesn’t increase until after both attacks. If both attacks hit, you can move the creatures close to one another or closer to you. The damage increases by 1d8.

name: Wisp Ally
description: You summon a Tiny bouncing wisp of light that easily distracts even the most determined of combatants. A wisp doesn’t take up space, grant flanking, or have any other attributes a creature would. The wisp generates bright light in a 10-foot radius. When you [Cast the Spell](link_action_19611) and each time you [Sustain](link_action_19858), you can direct the wisp to move to a creature you choose within range and attempt to distract the target. Each creature who fails a Will save against a distracting wisp becomes off-guard until the end of their next turn. If the creature fails a Will save against a second wisp in the same round, it becomes dazzled until the end of its next turn instead.

text.text: You create one additional wisp when you [Cast the Spell](link_action_19611). When you [Sustain](link_action_19858) this spell, you can move all wisps you’ve created.

name: Holographic Memory
description:
You reach into the target’s mind, extract a specific memory you have some awareness of, and project it into a hologram. The holographic memory can be no longer than 1 minute; if the extracted memory is longer than this, the hologram simply ends at that point. The hologram includes audio as well as [visual](link_trait_1479) components, but it does not contain haptic, olfactory, or other components. The hologram typically plays a memory that takes place in a single scene, though it can cut to multiple scenes, if they are accurate to the memory and its length allows. The hologram plays the memory exactly as the target experienced it and from the target’s perspective, so it often lacks context.

This spell can target any living, unconscious, or deceased sentient creature with an Intelligence attribute modifier of –3 or higher. If the target is deceased, it can’t have been dead for longer than 1 week, or this spell fails; once a corpse has been subjected to _hologram memory_ by any caster, any subsequent castings of _hologram memory_ fail.

If the target is unwilling to share this memory, it can attempt a Will save to resist this spell.

name: X-Ray Vision
description: You make a gesture over your eyes, allowing you to see through most materials and walls within 60 feet. Your sight is blocked by 2 feet of wood or plastic, 1 foot of stone, 2 inches of common metal, or any amount of lead or any starmetal, and you can only see in black and white.

name: Howl
description:
You let out a powerful ululation full of psychic resonance that compels others who hear it to join in. You deal 7d12 [sonic](link_trait_1484) damage and 1d10 persistent [mental](link_trait_1448) damage to other creatures who can hear within the area. Targets must attempt a Will save. The persistent [mental](link_trait_1448) damage from this spell increases by 1 for each creature affected by this spell who remains howling. A howling creature can’t use auditory actions or cast spells except for those with the subtle trait for 1 round. Calculate the persistent damage after all creatures attempted their saves.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target takes half damage and no persistent [mental](link_trait_1448) damage.

**Failure** The target takes full damage, persistent damage, and is compelled to howl as long as it takes persistent [mental](link_trait_1448) damage.

**Critical Failure** The target takes double damage, persistent damage, and is compelled to howl as long as it takes persistent [mental](link_trait_1448) damage.

name: Implant Data
description: You reprogram a computer or device to display a chosen piece of data when accessed. You can implant up to one piece of data per spell rank. A piece of data can be a simple fact, such as a creature or object’s location or physical description; an image of a creature or object; or a simple statement of no more than 280 characters. When the target computer or device is accessed, this implanted data is the first data the accessing creature gains, regardless of what data the creature is looking for. Implanted data doesn’t prevent a creature from accessing other information stored on a device, change how the device functions, or otherwise inhibit the device from functioning. If this spell’s duration ends before a creature accesses the implanted data, the information vanishes.

text.text: The duration is one year.
The duration is unlimited.

name: Inject Nanobots
description: You inject [magical](link_trait_1504) nanobots into a creature. Make a melee spell attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 5d6 [acid](link_trait_1528) damage. On a critical hit, the nanobots swarm through the target’s biological or mechanical systems, causing the creature to take double damage and be confused for 1 round.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Injury Echo
description: You manifest an injury from the future or past to harm a creature in the present. Choose bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. The target takes 1d6 of the selected damage type with a basic Will save. If the target fails its save and then takes the same type of damage before the end of your next turn, it takes an additional 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

text.text: The initial damage increases by 1d6, and the persistent damage on a failure increases by 1d4.

name: Instant Virus
description:
Your touch installs a dangerous self-replicating virus that disrupts a technological creature’s programming. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target is glitching 1.

**Failure** The target is glitching 1 and stunned 1.

**Critical Failure** The target is glitching 2 and stunned 2.

name: Logic Bomb
targets: 1 computer or item with the tech trait
description: You implant a hazard containing a mind-blowing amount of information into the target. The hazard has a Stealth and [Disable](link_action_19625) DC equal to your spell DC and requires one successful Computers check to disable. The first time a creature unsuccessfully attempts to access, destroy, or otherwise [manipulate](link_trait_1433) the target (such as using the Computers skill, failing to hit with a [Strike](link_action_19856), or otherwise), _logic bomb_ detonates and the creature takes 6d6 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage. The spell ends when it’s triggered or the duration ends, whichever comes first. When you prepare spells, you can choose not to recover the spell slot you used to cast this spell. If you do, the _logic bomb_ active remains for another 24 hours.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Irradiate
description: You rapidly destabilize and decay the atoms around you to create a burst of magically enhanced mild [radiation](link_trait_2522). This magical [radiation](link_trait_2522) uses your spell DC in place of the [radiation](link_trait_2522)’s normal Fortitude DC, has an immediate onset, and the interval between each stage is 1 round. Technology doesn’t gain the glitching condition from the [radiation](link_trait_2522) created by this spell.

text.text: The radiation increases to severe.
The radiation increases to extreme.
The radiation increases to incredible.

name: Selective Invisibility
targets: 1 creature touched and one within range
description: A willing creature becomes invisible to everyone except a second target within the spell’s range. If the invisible creature uses a hostile action against anyone who is not the target that can see them, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

text.text: You may touch an additional creature to make them invisible, but they all must have the same target

name: Life Seal
trigger: A creature within range enters an environment that would be harmful to it.
description: A shimmering bubble envelops the target’s entire body, allowing it to breathe normally in a vacuum or other unsafe environment and protecting it from severe temperatures and [radiation](link_trait_2522). The effect ends as soon as the target returns to a hospitable environment.

text.text: You can target up to 4 creatures, and the spell lasts for 6 hours.
You can target up to 6 creatures, the spell lasts for 8 hours, and it protects against extreme temperatures and [radiation](link_trait_2522).
You can target up to 12 creatures, the spell lasts for 12 hours, and it protects against incredible temperatures and [radiation](link_trait_2522).

name: Light Scour
description:
A sphere of searing light blossoms into existence to cleanse the universe of the taint of undeath and the metaphysical void. This deals 10d10 [vitality](link_trait_1478) damage to all [undead](link_trait_2425) creatures in the area based on their Reflex save. Each living creature in the area restores 50 Hit Points. If _light scour_ overlaps with an area of [magical](link_trait_1504) [darkness](link_trait_1900) or a creature affected by [magical](link_trait_1504) [darkness](link_trait_1900), light scour attempts to [counteract](link_action_27519) the [darkness](link_trait_1900) effect.

**Critical Success** The [undead](link_trait_2425) creature is unaffected.

**Success** The [undead](link_trait_2425) creature takes half damage.

**Failure** The [undead](link_trait_2425) creature takes full damage.

**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and 2d10 persistent [vitality](link_trait_1478) damage.

text.text: Increase the [vitality](link_trait_1478) damage to [undead](link_trait_2425) by 2d10. Increase the [healing](link_trait_1442) to living creatures by 5.

name: Measure
description: You learn the approximate measurements (length, width, depth, height, and weight) of creatures and objects you can observe in the area. If an object or creature extends out of the area, you learn only the measurements within the area, but nothing about what you can’t observe. For example, you can’t determine the thickness or weight of a wall you can observe only one side of, or the depth of water that extends beyond the spell’s range. Each time you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell, you learn the exact measurements of one creature or object in the area, including imprecisions or anomalies that might indicate structural weakness. [Magically](link_trait_1504) altered targets give you information that reflects what you observe rather than accurate measurements.

name: Metamorphose
description: You incite a primordial transformation in the target, causing its appendages to become blood-soaked, mantid-like claws. The target gains a claw attack that deals 1d6 slashing damage and has the [agile](link_trait_1569), [finesse](link_trait_1570), and [unarmed](link_trait_2398) traits. If the target already has a claw attack, it deals 1d8 damage instead. The target can’t hold any items or perform any [manipulate](link_trait_1433) actions that require the use of dexterous appendages. If the target was holding any objects, they become melded into its body and return to the target’s appendages when the spell ends. An unwilling target may attempt a Fortitude save to negate the effects of this spell when targeted by the spell and at the end of each of its turns.

text.text: The spell can affect up to 6 creatures.

name: Mind Skewer
description: You overload a creature’s mind with a glut of psychic information or divine judgments. The mental onslaught deals 2d6 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage. On a critical hit, the target takes 4d6 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage and is stupefied 2 for 1 round.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Motivating Ringtone
requirements: You have a comm unit, used as a locus, and the contact info of the target.
description: You cause the target [comm unit](link_item_16072) to play a cosmically composed personal theme song specific to its owner. The creature who owns the target regains 1d8+4 Hit Points when you [Cast the Spell](link_action_19611), a +5-foot status bonus to all Speeds, and a +1 status bonus to saves against [fear](link_trait_1487) effects for the duration, as long as the [comm unit](link_item_16072) continues to play the ringtone. Creatures beginning their turn adjacent to an ally with an active ringtone gain the status bonus to Speeds and bonus to saves until the start of their next turn.

text.text: The amount of [healing](link_trait_1442) increases by 1d8+4.

name: New Game
requirements: You have access to a computer with a vidgame installed on it, which can be one designed for this spell, used as a locus
description:
You draw multiple creatures into a vidgame, digitalizing their bodies and minds, including equipment, to play in virtual reality. The genre of the game and effect of the spell depend on who you target when you cast it. Any creature targeted by this spell becomes immune to it for 24 hours, no matter what genre they experience.

*   If you cast the spell targeting yourself or any number of willing allies, the target enters a relaxing slice-of-life social simulation game where they can perform up to 1 hour of activities for the duration of the spell, including [Refocusing](link_action_19754), [Repairing](link_action_19756) items, or simply evading an enemy by hiding in this virtual [extradimensional](link_trait_1559) space.
    
*   If you cast this spell targeting yourself or one willing ally, and one enemy, the targets enter a PvP game and are instructed to fight. For the duration of the spell, either creature can manipulate fate once on each of its turns. This allows it to either roll twice and take the higher result on an attack roll or skill check it makes against its opponent (a [fortune](link_trait_1460) effect) or force the opponent to roll twice on a saving throw against one of its abilities and take the lower result (a [misfortune](link_trait_1677) effect). The GM may decide that other genres of games exist that add additional rules or subsystems to resolving the spell. The spell ends if either target becomes unable to act, or if they both agree to cease hostilities. If a player dies in this game, they die in real life.
    
*   If you cast this spell targeting one enemy, the target enters a PvE or puzzle game that traps them until they can complete the game. Once each turn, the target can spend 1 action to attempt a Computers or Perception check against your spell DC to escape the game. Teleportation magic doesn’t help the creature escape unless the magic can transport someone into or out of a virtual space. When the spell ends, either because the target escaped or the duration ran out, the target returns to the space it occupied when it was digitized, or to the nearest space if the original is now filled. The GM may decide that other genres of games allow for different skill checks, but should only do so if the target has proficiency in the listed skill.
    
    **Critical Success** The target completes the game and the spell ends.
    
    **Success** The target makes progress toward completing the game. If the target already made progress, it completes the game and the spell ends.
    
    **Failure** The target makes no progress toward completing the game.
    
    **Critical Failure** The target loses the game and has to start over. It loses all progress it made.

name: Skyfire Wings
description: Wings of plasma grow from your body that propel you to soar high above your enemies, or scorch them for getting too close. You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater. Your arms (or primary set of arms) turn into wings that can’t hold items or wield weapons. You drop any held equipment in those arms. You gain a wing [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack that deals 1d8 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage and has the [backswing](link_trait_1619), [reach](link_trait_1573), and [unarmed](link_trait_2398) traits. On a critical hit, a target of your wing attack takes 2 persistent [electricity](link_trait_1576) damage.

text.text: Your wings deal 2d8 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage and 4 persistent [electricity](link_trait_1576) damage on a critical hit. The duration increases to 5 minutes.
Your wings deal 3d8 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage and 6 persistent [electricity](link_trait_1576) damage on a critical hit. The duration increases to 1 hour.
Your wings deal 4d8 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage and 8 persistent [electricity](link_trait_1576) damage on a critical hit. The duration increases to 8 hours.

name: Slice Reality
description: You slice through reality, forming a chasm of life-draining entropy in a straight line 20 feet high, 120 feet long, and 2 inches thick. The chasm provides cover. The chasm deals 7d8 [void](link_trait_1485) damage to each creature that’s in the chasm’s space when it is created, that attempts to pass through the chasm, or that ends its turn inside the chasm, with a basic Reflex save. A creature that succeeds at this save when the chasm is created is pushed to the nearest space on the side of its choice. Creatures trying to move through the chasm fail to do so if they critically fail the save, ending their movement next to the chasm.

text.text: The damage increases by 1d8.

name: Sonic Scream
description: You unleash a painfully rapid cone of vibrations by letting out a cathartic scream, dealing 1d8 [sonic](link_trait_1484) damage to creatures in the area. A creature that fails its saving throw also becomes sickened 1.

text.text: Increases the damage by 1d8.

name: Soul Surge
description: Make a ranged spell attack against the target’s AC. On a hit, you deal 6d6 [spirit](link_trait_1556) damage. On a critical hit, the target takes double the damage and becomes drained 1. You lose 6 Hit Points or, if you are in a bond with a vitality network that has at least 6 Hit Points, you can reduce the vitality bond’s HP by 6 instead.

text.text: Increases the damage dealt by 2d6 and the Hit Points lost by 2.

name: Speak with Computers (Playtest)
description: You can ask questions of and receive answers from the spirits inhabiting a computer. These synthetic spirits manifest within computer code and often have personalities colored by the nature of the device, its condition, and its applications and personalized settings. A computer’s perspective, perception, and knowledge give it a worldview different enough from a human’s that it doesn’t consider the same details important. Computers can mostly answer questions about creatures that interfaced with them in the past and what information is concealed within their files.

text.text: The duration is 8 hours.

name: Stumble
description:
A burst of microgravity causes a tremor around the target, pulling it toward the ground. The target attempts a Reflex save.

**Failure** The target becomes off-guard for 1 round. If the target was flying, swimming, or floating, it falls 10 feet downward.

**Critical Failure** The target falls prone. If the target was flying, swimming, or floating, it falls 20 feet downward.

text.text: If the target is flying, it falls an additional 10 feet on a failure and 20 feet on a critical failure.

name: Telekinetic Strangulation
description: You psychically grasp a creature’s throat or similar vital anatomy with a vicelike grip, forcefully lifting it a few inches off the ground as it struggles to breathe. Make a ranged spell attack against the target’s AC. On a hit, you deal 6d12 bludgeoning damage and the target is immobilized. For each round you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell, the target takes 1d12 persistent bludgeoning damage, remains immobilized, and must continue holding its breath. While immobilized in this way, it must hold its breath or begin suffocating. The target can attempt to [Escape](link_action_19632) (the [Escape](link_action_19632) DC is your spell DC and the [Escape](link_action_19632) attempt is affected by the [incapacitation](link_trait_1481) trait).

name: Summon Robot
description: You call upon a robot to fight for you. This works like _summon animal_, except you summon a common creature that has the [tech](link_trait_3677) trait and whose level is –1. Heightening the spell increases the maximum level of creature you can summon.

text.text: Level 1.
Level 2.
Level 3.
Level 5.
Level 7.
Level 9.
Level 11.
Level 13.
Level 15.

name: Supercharge Weapon
description: You draw in and condense ambient [magical](link_trait_1504) energy from around you to power up a weapon. The next [Strike](link_action_19856) made using that weapon is supercharged. That [Strike](link_action_19856) deals an additional 1d6 extra damage of the same type as the weapon’s normal damage.

text.text: The extra damage increases by 1d6.

name: Forget
targets: 1 creature or object in your quantum field
description:
You force creatures to temporarily forget about the target. The target is invisible while within your quantum field, and memories of the target are temporarily erased or rewritten. This makes it undetected to all creatures.

The first time an enemy attempts to locate the target (such as by [Seeking](link_action_19845)) or uses [Recall Knowledge](link_action_19753) to recall information about the target, they take 8d8 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage with a basic Will save as they suffer painful migraines while trying to process information about the missing target. On a critical failure the enemy is also confused for 1 round.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d8.

name: Telekinetic Tantrum
description:
You launch a barrage of powerful psychokinetic energy that overpowers creatures, hurls objects, and deals damage. When you [Cast this Spell](link_action_19611) and the first time each round you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell, you can choose one of the following effects. You can’t choose the same effect twice in a row.

*   **Back Off!** You hurl up to 15 objects or creatures up to 40 feet in any direction (including up or down). You can hurl up to a total weight of 400 pounds or 40 Bulk per creature or object. Creatures take bludgeoning damage based on the distance they moved and land prone, as though they’d taken falling damage. Creatures being moved can attempt a Fortitude save to ignore the effect.
    
*   **Hard Rain** You pummel all creatures in the area with debris and objects in the area, dealing 5d10 bludgeoning damage with a basic Reflex save.
    
*   **Psychokinetic Slam** Your psychokinetic storm slams into all creatures in the area. Make a ranged spell attack roll. All targets you would hit take 7d6 [force](link_trait_1560) damage and are stunned 1.

name: Skim Data
targets: one data set contained within a touched object
description: You touch one object and concentrate on a data set contained within it, such as a story, message, file, infosphere site, or video. You understand the gist of the data set and can quickly locate the most relevant pages or sections to your search. If the data set is written in a language you don’t know, or you attempt to gain information from a computer you don’t have access to, the spell fails. If you [Cast this Spell](link_action_19611) as part of a [Research](link_action_34582) activity, you treat a critical failure as a failure instead.

name: Personal Gravity
description: You alter gravity’s effects on you. You treat gravity as if it were your choice of one step higher or lower (for example, if you were in an area of low gravity, you could choose either standard gravity or zero-g). While the spell is active, you reduce the distance of any forced movement that would affect you by 5 feet (minimum 0 feet), and you ignore being clumsy and untethered because of gravity effects on you. You can [Dismiss](link_action_19627) the spell.

name: Time's Edge
description:
You refract latent energy from the Dimension of Time into your current plane in the form of a massive blade, dealing 6d6 slashing damage to all creatures in the area, representing the passage of time within the space. Creatures within the area must attempt a Fortitude save.

**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

**Success** The creature takes half damage.

**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is sickened 1.

**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is drained 1.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Uncanny Eruption
description: You cause the ground to swell and erupt into a fiery crater, dealing 4d6 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage to all creatures in a 30-foot burst and any creature who ends their turn in the area of the spell, with a basic Reflex save. The area becomes difficult terrain and hazardous terrain. A creature that moves through the area takes 3 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage for every square of that area it moves into. Whenever you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell, roll a DC 10 flat check. On a success, the volcano erupts and deals 4d6 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage to all creatures in the area. On a failure, the flat check becomes DC 5 the next time you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Absolute Zero
description:
A swirling vortex flash freezes the air, dealing 10d8 [cold](link_trait_1519) damage as a rime of frost spreads over everything in its path. Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude save.

**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected. Success The creature takes half damage.

**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is slowed 1 until the start of your next turn.

**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage, is immobilized by a layer of ice, and is slowed 1 as long as it’s immobilized. The creature can still try to [Escape](link_action_19632), and it or others can break the ice by attacking it (the ice has AC 33 and 35 Hit Points).

text.text: The damage increases by 1d8. The ice’s AC increases by 2 and its Hit Points increase by 5.

name: Overheat
description: You collect heat generated by nearby bodies and [technological](link_trait_3677) devices and vent it toward a nearby target. You deal 2d6 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage to the target. On a failed save, the target’s held equipment becomes hot to the touch for the next round. Unless the target drops its currently held equipment at the start of its turn, it takes 3 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage.

text.text: The damage increases by 2d6. Increase the damage of touching affected objects by 3.

name: Verdant Code
description:
You cause flowering vines or other plant matter to grow from a computer or unattended other device. Plant matter explodes from the target device, filling all squares within a 20-foot radius. Each round a creature starts its turn in the area, it takes 2d6 piercing damage and must attempt a Reflex save. The growth also covers the device, requiring a successful DC 5 flat check for non-remote access for the spell’s duration.

**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

**Success** The creature takes half damage.

**Failure** The creature takes full damage.

**Critical Failure** The creature takes full damage and is immobilized for 1 round.

name: Adhere
description:
You create a molecular bond between an object you touch and another object or surface that object is touching. Pulling the object free of that surface requires a successful Athletics check against your spell DC to [Force Open](link_action_19722).

If you instead touch one unoccupied 5-foot square, that surface becomes charged with adhering magic. That space becomes greater difficult terrain.

name: Overload Systems
description:
You flood the area with electrical interference. You deal 8d8 [electricity](link_trait_1576) damage to all other creatures in the area. Each creature in the area must attempt a Will save.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target takes half damage.

**Failure** The target takes full damage, and any items with the [tech](link_trait_3677) trait become glitching 1 for 1 minute or until the condition is removed.

**Critical Failure** The target takes double damage, and any items with the [tech](link_trait_3677) trait become glitching 2 for 1 minute or until the condition is removed.

name: Akashic Download
requirements: You have a comm unit, used as a locus.
description:
You do a cosmic search of the Akashic Record for information about a specific topic by using your comm unit to [magically](link_trait_1504) access that distant realm. When you [Cast this Spell](link_action_19611), choose any skill in which you are at least trained that has the [Recall Knowledge](link_action_19753) action.

Any time during the duration, you can consult your comm unit while attempting a [Recall Knowledge](link_action_19753) check using your chosen skill. This check gains a +1 status bonus. Checking your comm unit is part of the action to [Recall Knowledge](link_action_19753). You must be holding the comm unit to do so. The comm unit instantly compiles and displays snippets and selections from various media relevant to the topic, which grants you the bonus. If you roll a critical failure on this check, you get a failure instead. If the check is successful and the subject is a creature, you gain additional information or context about the creature. Once you reference the comm unit, the spell ends. When the spell ends, your access to the Akashic Record ends and all the information you downloaded returns to the Akashic Record.

text.text: The status bonus increases to +2, and you can reference your comm unit twice before the spell ends.
The status bonus increases to +3, and you can reference your comm unit three times before the spell ends.
The status bonus increases to +4, and you can reference your comm unit four times before the spell ends.

name: Analyze Target
description: You focus on the target, gathering data as magical holograms display information. When the [casting](link_action_19611) is complete, you learn biometric information about the target, including its fingerprints, medical conditions, and other basic physiological information. You or anyone you advise about the analysis gains a +1 circumstance bonus to [Impersonate](link_action_19731) the creature, on Medicine checks to [Treat Wounds](link_action_19864), and to [Recall Knowledge](link_action_19753) actions about the creature. If the creature is [illusory](link_trait_1447) or under the effects of [illusion](link_trait_1447) magic, you detect this only if the effect’s rank is lower than the spell rank of your analyze target spell.

text.text: The circumstance bonus increases to +2 and you can target up to 10 creatures.
The circumstance bonus increases to +3 and you can target any number of creatures.

name: Akashic Revival
description:
You dispatch perfect documentation of your physical body to the Akashic Record, allowing you to later recall this record and reconstruct your body as it was when you cast this spell. The record of your body includes your current Hit Points, augmentations, attribute modifiers, and any afflictions or conditions you had.

If you die of anything other than old age, you can immediately recall your recorded body from the Akashic Record. Your new physical body appears at the start of your next turn. Your corpse disappears and you instantly reappear in your recorded body in the corpse’s space and with any worn equipment. You re-form standing and can choose to pick up any equipment you dropped in the space from when you died. If you cannot occupy that space, you appear as close to it as possible, though you must still retrieve your equipment. You retain your mind as it was at the time of your body’s death, so you regain no expended spells, Focus Points, or uses of special abilities. Any [mental](link_trait_1448) effects affecting you at the time of your death persist in your new body.

Retrieving your body from the Akashic Record or having the duration expire removes your stored information from the Akashic Record, requiring you to [cast](link_action_19611) this spell again.

name: Atomic Blast
description:
You magically split an atom, creating an explosion with radioactive fallout. All targets in the area take 5d12 bludgeoning damage and 5d12 [fire](link_trait_1542) damage, and they are exposed to extreme [radiation](link_trait_2522). The onset and frequency of this [magical](link_trait_1504) [radiation](link_trait_2522) is 1 round, and the area remains radioactive for 10 minutes.

**Critical Success** The target takes half damage.

**Success** The target takes half damage and is dazzled for 1 minute.

**Failure** The target takes full damage and is blinded for 1 minute.

**Critical Failure** As failure, and the target takes double damage.

name: Cellular Stimulant
targets: 1 living creature that is not fatigued or quickened
description: You vitalize and stimulate the target at a cellular level, giving it a temporary burst of energy that unfortunately takes an exhausting toll. The target attempts a Fortitude save (it may choose to fail). If the target fails, it gains the quickened condition and can use the extra action to [Stride](link_action_19855) or [Strike](link_action_19856). After that round ends, the target becomes fatigued until it can rest for 10 minutes.

text.text: You can target up to 6 allies or 6 enemies by using 2 actions to [Cast this Spell](link_action_19611).

name: Control Machine
targets: 1 creature or hazard with the tech trait
duration:
until the next time you make your
daily preparations
description:
You take control of a [technological](link_trait_3677) creature or object and command it telepathically. If you issue an obviously self-destructive order to a sapient target, the target does not act until you issue a new order. The effect depends on its Will save.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target is stunned 1 as it fights off your commands.

**Failure** You control the target. It gains the controlled condition, but it can attempt a Will save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.

**Critical Failure** As a failure, but the target receives a new save only if it’s sapient and you give it a new order that is against its nature, such as killing its allies.

text.text: The duration is unlimited.

name: Corrosive Haze
requirements: 120 feet
description: You unleash a cloud of corrosive nanites. Creatures that start their turn in the area take 6d8 [acid](link_trait_1528) damage and 1d6 persistent [acid](link_trait_1528) damage with a basic Fortitude save. The nanites also corrode any unattended objects in the area, dealing 3d8 [acid](link_trait_1528) damage. Each round you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell, you can move the cloud up to 10 feet in any direction. You can [Dismiss](link_action_19627) the spell.

text.text: The initial damage increases by 1d8, and the persistent [acid](link_trait_1528) damage increases by 1d6.

name: Discharge
targets: 1 creature or object with the tech trait
description:
You ignite a sudden spark of electricity that surges into a technological creature or object. You de-energize an item with the [tech](link_trait_3677) trait or disrupt a creature with the [tech](link_trait_3677) trait, with effects based on choosing creature or object.

*   **Creature** If your target is a creature with the tech trait, it attempts a Will save. On a failure, the creature is glitching 1; on a critical failure, the creature is glitching 2.
    
*   **Object** If you target an attended object, the creature with the object attempts a Will save. On a success, the object loses half of its maximum charges. On a failure, or if you target an unattended object, the object loses all its remaining charges.

name: Eldritch Lance
description: You condense a beam of mind-assaulting eldritch energy from the dark spaces between the stars and fire it at a target. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target’s AC. If you hit, you deal 2d6 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage. On a critical success, you deal double damage.

text.text: The damage increases by 1d6.

name: Eldritch Wrath
description:
You channel the unspeakable powers that exist beyond the outer reaches of the universe, dealing 3d12 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage to each creature in the area as phantasmal claws, jaws, and tentacles lash out at each target. Each creature in the area must attempt a Will save. The area is difficult terrain for any creature sickened by the effects of this spell.

**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

**Success** The creature takes half damage.

**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is sickened 1.

**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is sickened 2.

text.text: The damage increases by 1d12.

name: Avatar
description:
You transform into an avatar of your deity, assuming a Huge battle form. You have hands in this battle form and can take [manipulate](link_trait_1433) actions. You can [Dismiss](link_action_19627) this spell.

You gain the following statistics and abilities regardless of which deity’s battle form you assume:

*   AC = 25 + your level. Ignore your armor’s check penalty and Speed reduction.
    
*   30 temporary Hit Points.
    
*   One or more attacks specific to your deity’s battle form, which are the only attacks you can [Strike](link_action_19856) with. You’re trained with them. Your attack modifier is +33, and you use the listed damage. Melee attacks are Strength based (for the purposes of the enfeebled condition, for example) unless they have the [finesse](link_trait_1570) trait, and all ranged attacks are Dexterity based.
    
*   Athletics modifier of +35, unless your own is higher.
    

You also gain the abilities listed for your deity below:

*   **Abadar**
    
    *   Speed 50 feet, burrow 30 feet, immune to immobilized;
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> crossbolter (range increment 120 feet, reload 1), Damage 6d10+3 piercing.
        
*   **Besmara**
    
    *   Speed 40 feet, swim Speed 70 feet, immune to immobilized;
        
    *   Melee rapier ([deadly](link_trait_2530) 3d8, [disarm](link_trait_1604), [finesse](link_trait_1570), [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d6+6 piercing;
        
    *   Ranged ship’s cannon (range 120 feet), Damage 6d6+3 bludgeoning.
        
*   **Damoritosh**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, immune to immobilized
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> doshko ([sweep](link_trait_1562), [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d12+6 slashing.
        
*   **Desna**
    
    *   Speed 30 feet, fly 70 feet
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> starknife ([agile](link_trait_1569), [deadly](link_trait_2530) 3d4, [finesse](link_trait_1570), [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet, [silver](link_item_15062), [thrown](link_trait_1575) 60 feet), Damage 6d4+6 piercing;
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> moonbeam (range 120 feet, [silver](link_item_15062)), Damage 6d6+3 [fire](link_trait_1542).
        
*   **The Devourer**
    
    *   Speed 50 feet, burrow 30 feet, immune to immobilized;
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> jaws ([reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d12+6 piercing;
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> disintegration tendril ([agile](link_trait_1569), [reach](link_trait_1573) 20 feet, [versatile P](link_trait_1854)), Damage 6d8+6 [acid](link_trait_1528).
        
*   **Eloritu**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, ignore difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain;
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> singing spear ([reach](link_trait_1573) 20 feet, [versatile P](link_trait_1854)) 6d6+3 [sonic](link_trait_1484);
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> singing spear (range increment 40 feet), Damage 3d8+1 piercing and 3d8+1 [sonic](link_trait_1484).
        
*   **Hylax**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, fly 70 feet, [thoughtsense](link_sense_25589) (precise) 60 feet;
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> talon ([reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet, [versatile S](link_trait_1837)), Damage 6d8+6 [acid](link_trait_1528);
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> pacifying buzz ([nonlethal](link_trait_1571), range 60 feet), Damage 6d6+3 [mental](link_trait_1448).
        
*   **Ibra**
    
    *   Speed 30 feet, fly 70 feet; ignore hazardous terrain;
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> plasma blast (range 100 feet), Damage 6d8+3 [fire](link_trait_1542) plus 2d8 persistent [electricity](link_trait_1576).
        
*   **Iomedae**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, fly 70 feet; shield (15 Hardness, can’t be damaged)
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> longsword ([reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet, [versatile P](link_trait_1854)), Damage 6d8+6 slashing.
        
*   **Lao Shu Po**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, climb 70 feet, immune to frightened
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> bite ([reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d8+6 piercing
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> nightmare rat swarm (range 120 feet), Damage 6d6+4 piercing and [mental](link_trait_1448).
        
*   **The Newborn**
    
    *   Speed no land Speed, fly 70 feet, immune to [mental](link_trait_1448) effects
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> planetary debris (range 120 feet), Damage 6d10 [void](link_trait_1485).
        
*   **Oras**
    
    *   Speed 50 feet, burrow 30 feet, fly 50 feet, swim 50 feet
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> tentacle ([agile](link_trait_1569), [finesse](link_trait_1570), [reach](link_trait_1573) 20 feet, [versatile S](link_trait_1837)), Damage 6d6 bludgeoning
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> virulent protoslime (range 120 feet), Damage 6d6+3 [poison](link_trait_1476).
        
*   **Pharasma**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, fly 70 feet
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> dagger ([agile](link_trait_1569), [finesse](link_trait_1570), [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet, thrown 40 feet), Damage 6d6+6 slashing
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> spiral blast (range 120 feet, damages only [undead](link_trait_2425)), Damage 6d8+3 [vitality](link_trait_1478).
        
*   **Sarenrae**
    
    *   Speed 30 feet, fly 70 feet
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> scimitar (forceful, [nonlethal](link_trait_1571), [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d6+6 slashing
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> everflame ([nonlethal](link_trait_1571), range 120 feet), Damage 6d6+3 [fire](link_trait_1542).
        
*   **Talavet**
    
    *   Speed 30 feet, fly 70 feet
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> spined iceblade ([agile](link_trait_1569), [finesse](link_trait_1570), [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d6+3 slashing
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> forbidden knowledge ([nonlethal](link_trait_1571), range 120 feet), Damage 6d6+3 [mental](link_trait_1448).
        
*   **Triune**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, character and gear are immune to glitching;
        
    *   Melee shock pad ([nonlethal](link_trait_1571), [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d6+6 [electricity](link_trait_1576)
        
    *   Ranged logic blast (range 120 feet), Damage 6d6+3 [mental](link_trait_1448).
        
*   **Urgathoa**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, fly 70 feet
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> scythe ([deadly](link_trait_2530) 3d10, trip, [reach](link_trait_1573) 15 feet), Damage 6d10+6 slashing
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> pallid plague (range 120 feet), Damage 6d6+3 [void](link_trait_1485).
        
*   **Weydan**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, fly 70 feet, immune to immobilized
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> laser rifle (range 100 feet), Damage 6d8+6 [fire](link_trait_1542).
        
*   **Yaraesa**
    
    *   Speed 30 feet, fly 70 feet, +4 status bonus to saves against [mental](link_trait_1448) effects
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> seeker rifle (range 120 feet), Damage 6d10+2 piercing.
        
*   **Zon-Shelyn**
    
    *   Speed 70 feet, fly 70 feet, ignore difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain
        
    *   Melee <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> painglaive ([deadly](link_trait_2530) 3d8, [reach](link_trait_1573) 20 feet), Damage 6d8+6 slashing
        
    *   Ranged <abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> melody of midnight beauty ([nonlethal](link_trait_1571), range 120 feet), Damage 3d6+1 [sonic](link_trait_1484) and 3d6+1 [mental](link_trait_1448).

name: Cairn Form
description: Your target’s skin becomes a thick carapace of solid stone, granting resistance 5 to physical damage, except [adamantine](link_item_15064). The target gains a fist [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack that deals 2d6 bludgeoning damage. The target uses their highest weapon or [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack proficiency with these attacks, and if they have weapon specialization or greater weapon specialization, they add this damage as well. On a critical hit with one of these [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attacks, the creature struck attempts a Fortitude save against the target’s class DC or is stunned 1 for 1 round.

text.text: The resistance increases to 10 and the damage dealt by the attacks increases to 3d6.
The resistance increases to 20 and the damage dealt by the attacks increases to 4d6.

name: Caustic Conversion
description: You launch a torrent of [magical](link_trait_1504) nanites that begin dissolving your target. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, you deal 3d8 [acid](link_trait_1528) damage plus 1d6 persistent [acid](link_trait_1528) damage. On a critical hit, double the initial damage, but not the persistent damage.

text.text: The initial damage increases by 2d8, and the persistent [acid](link_trait_1528) damage increases by 1d6.

name: Delete
targets: 1 data set or tech item with the tracking trait
description:
You delete data from a device or object with a flamboyant magical gesture. This data might be handwritten, printed, or digital. You delete up to 1,500 words worth of text, one page of content, or one display screen worth of text or other [visual](link_trait_1479) information. Non-[magical](link_trait_1504) writing in or on an unattended or held object is automatically deleted. Attempt a [counteract](link_action_27519) check to delete [magical](link_trait_1504) writing (using your spellcasting attribute modifier plus your spellcasting proficiency bonus) or digital content (using your spellcasting attribute modifier plus your Computers proficiency bonus). If you fail to delete writing that is part of a hazard, you trigger the hazard. This can’t be used to delete the contents of a spellbook or similar means of storing [magical](link_trait_1504) formulas or spells.

If you target an attended [tech](link_trait_3677) item with the tracking trait, attempt a [counteract](link_action_27519) check using your spellcasting attribute modifier plus your Computers proficiency bonus. On a success, the item becomes glitching 1. A creature holding the item can spend a single action with the [Interact](link_action_19733) trait to restart the UI, reducing the glitching value by 1.

text.text: You can delete all the data stored locally on a single device or book, or all the data on a device or book related to a specific name, topic, or category.

name: Destruction Protocol
targets: 1 creature with the construct or tech trait
description:
You magically reprogram a construct to attack your enemies, even if following your orders puts the target in danger. Your target must be level –1 and not already programmed or tasked to harm you. The target attempts a Will save. The target’s behavior is altered according to its save. Heightening the spell increases the maximum level of creature you can reprogram.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target immediately [Steps](link_action_19853) in a direction chosen by the caster.

**Failure** At the start of the target’s next turn, it [Strides](link_action_19855) in a direction chosen by the caster and makes a [Strike](link_action_19856) against a target chosen by the caster. These actions don’t count towards the target’s regular actions that round.

**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target [Strides](link_action_19855) twice as directed by the caster.

text.text: The target can be up to 1st level.
The target can be up to 2nd level.
The target can be up to 3rd level
The target can be up to 5th level.
The target can be up to 7th level.
The target can be up to 9th level.
The target can be up to 11th level.
The target can be up to 13th level.
The target can be up to 15th level.

name: Elemental Weapon
description: You create an advanced, martial, or simple weapon out of elemental energy that materializes in the hands of a bonded creature. Select an elemental trait for the created weapon: [air](link_trait_1524), [earth](link_trait_1523), [fire](link_trait_1542), [metal](link_trait_2132), [water](link_trait_1584), or [wood](link_trait_1680). The weapon is tactical grade and comes fully charged and loaded with basic ammunition and cannot be made of any special materials. The weapon has one fewer upgrade slot but can be upgraded with any upgrades you hold in your hands as a locus when [casting](link_action_19611) this spell, which become inert until the spell ends. The weapon deals damage as normal plus 1d4 additional damage based on the chosen trait: [electricity](link_trait_1576) for [air](link_trait_1524), bludgeoning for [earth](link_trait_1523), [fire](link_trait_1542) for [fire](link_trait_1542), [acid](link_trait_1528) for [metal](link_trait_2132), [cold](link_trait_1519) for [water](link_trait_1584), or [poison](link_trait_1476) for [wood](link_trait_1680).

text.text: You can create an advanced weapon.
You can create a superior weapon.
You can create an elite weapon.
You can create an ultimate weapon.
You can create a paragon weapon.

name: Reorient (Playtest)
description: Applying a combination of vital energy and acupressure, you help the target regain its footing. The target loses the off-guard condition if they have it. The target becomes immune to the off-guard condition until the start of their next turn, even if it would be circumstantially applied, such as by being flanked or prone. The target is then immune to _reorient_ for 10 minutes.

name: Akashic Fount
description: You open the target’s mind to the Akashic Records to draw in feelings, memories, and knowledge contained within that astral repository. Choose one Lore skill. The target temporarily gains the same proficiency rank in that skill as your proficiency rank in Occultism.

name: Anthem
description: You compose the tangle of cosmic melodies into an anthem for your bonded companions. All bonded creatures in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls, and also gain a +1 status bonus to saves against effects that cause fascinated or confused.

name: Data Drain
description:
You leech memories and conscious thoughts from the target’s mind and convert it into astral data that you can record and analyze as easily as if the target’s psyche was ribbons of computer code. This deals 8d6 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage with a basic Will save.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target takes half damage and is stupefied 1 until the end of your current turn.

**Failure** The target takes full damage and is stupefied 1 until the end of your next turn. You read the data stolen from the target and can [Recall Knowledge](link_action_19753) about them.

**Critical Failure** As failure, except the target takes double damage and is stupefied 1 for 1 minute.

text.text: The [mental](link_trait_1448) damage increases by 2d6.

name: Cloying Shadows
description:
You command creatures’ shadows to writhe and lash out against their owners. Each creature in the area takes 6d6 [cold](link_trait_1519) damage.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target takes half damage.

**Failure** The target takes full damage and is sickened 1.

**Critical Failure** The target takes double damage and is sickened 2.

text.text: The [cold](link_trait_1519) damage increases by 2d6.

name: Elemental Nova
description: A roaring blast of elemental energy erupts around your targets. Select an elemental trait: [air](link_trait_1524), [earth](link_trait_1523), [fire](link_trait_1542), [metal](link_trait_2132), [water](link_trait_1584), or [wood](link_trait_1680). Elemental nova gains the trait you choose. Elemental nova deals 11d6 damage based on the chosen trait: [electricity](link_trait_1576) or [sonic](link_trait_1484) for [air](link_trait_1524), bludgeoning or piercing for [earth](link_trait_1523), [acid](link_trait_1528) or slashing for [metal](link_trait_2132), [fire](link_trait_1542) for [fire](link_trait_1542), [cold](link_trait_1519) for [water](link_trait_1584), or [poison](link_trait_1476) for [wood](link_trait_1680).

text.text: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Infusion
description:
You infuse the target’s essence with healing energy. If the target is a willing creature, you restore 1d6 (⬆️{{ceil(level/2)}}d6) Hit Points. The target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes. The number of actions you spend when [Casting this Spell](link_action_19611) determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

<abbr cost="ONE-ACTION" class="action-symbol">1</abbr> The spell has a range of touch.

<abbr cost="TWO-ACTIONS" class="action-symbol">2</abbr> The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you’re healing a creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 6 (⬆️{{ceil(level/2)}}\*6).

<abbr cost="THREE-ACTIONS" class="action-symbol">3</abbr> You heal all bonded creatures in a 30-foot emanation.

text.text: The amount of [healing](link_trait_1442) increases by 1d6, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 6.

name: Vitality Web
cost: any (see below)
description: Your network briefly manifests to members of your bond as a web of vital energy. As part of [casting](link_action_19611) this spell, each bonded creature can reach out and transfer any amount of their own number of Hit Points into your [vitality network](link_class-feature_35032).

name: Akashic Assistant
description: You summon a projection of one of the etheric entities that work as librarians and scribes within the Akashic Library to assist your target with a task. The projection appears floating next to the target and doesn’t occupy any space. The assistant prepares to Aid the target as though it had its own reaction. The assistant uses a bonus equal to your modifier in Occultism for its rolls to [Aid](link_action_19604), regardless of what skill it is [Aiding](link_action_19604) with. On each of your turns, the assistant prepares to [Aid](link_action_19604) its target again. You can use a free action, which has the [concentrate](link_trait_1432) trait, to redirect the assistant to a different creature, changing the target of the spell. Otherwise, the assistant keeps aiding the same creature for the duration of the spell.

name: Eldritch Bond
description:
You channel mysterious power from beyond the edges of the known universe to infuse a bonded companion with the essence of an eldritch creature. You grant the target up to two of the following abilities:

*   10-foot reach on all melee attacks.
    
*   Gain [mental](link_trait_1448) resistance equal to half the creature’s level (minimum 1).
    
*   Melee [strikes](link_action_19856) affect [incorporeal](link_trait_2424) creatures as if they had the ghost killer upgrade.
    
*   A tentacle [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack that deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage.
    
*   A stinger [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack that deals 1d6 [acid](link_trait_1528) damage and has the [agile](link_trait_1569) and [finesse](link_trait_1570) traits.
    
*   A beam ranged [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack with a range increment of 40 feet that deals 1d6 [mental](link_trait_1448) damage.
    
*   [Darkvision](link_sense_20769)

text.text: The damage dealt by the attacks increases to two dice.

name: Elemental Barrier
description: A barrier of protective elemental energy appears around the target, bolstering their defense. Select an elemental trait: [air](link_trait_1524), [earth](link_trait_1523), [fire](link_trait_1542), [metal](link_trait_2132), [water](link_trait_1584), or [wood](link_trait_1680). Elemental barrier gains the trait you chose. The target gets a +1 circumstance bonus to AC. While the spell is in effect, the target can use the [Shield Block](link_feat_20534) reaction as if the elemental barrier was a raised shield. The barrier has Hardness 6 and 40 HP. It increases its Hardness by 2 to one damage type based on the chosen trait: [electricity](link_trait_1576) or [sonic](link_trait_1484) for [air](link_trait_1524), bludgeoning or piercing for [earth](link_trait_1523), acid or slashing for [metal](link_trait_2132), [fire](link_trait_1542) for [fire](link_trait_1542), [cold](link_trait_1519) for [water](link_trait_1584), or [poison](link_trait_1476) for [wood](link_trait_1680). Unlike a normal [Shield Block](link_feat_20534), you can use the spell’s reaction against spells with the chosen elemental trait [cast](link_action_19611) against the creature.

text.text: The barrier has 48 HP.
The barrier has Hardness 8 and 52 HP.
The barrier has Hardness 8 and 60 HP.
The barrier has Hardness 10 and 68 HP.
The barrier has Hardness 10 and 80 HP.

name: Shadow Prison
description:
You cause memories of the target’s resentment, regret, and other negative feelings to engorge their shadow until it grows large enough to swallow them whole. The target attempts a Will saving throw. The target is then immune to this spell for 1 minute.

**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.

**Success** The target resists the spell before they’re completely swallowed up, but shadowy tendrils cling to them, making the target slowed 1 for 1 round.

**Failure** The target is swallowed by their own shadow until the beginning of your next turn. The target is invisible and paralyzed, cannot experience or interact with the outside world, and cannot be targeted by any attacks or other effects.

**Critical Failure** As failure, except the target is swallowed for 1 minute.

name: Shadow Snap
description:
With a snap of your fingers, you command the target’s shadow to either attack or stalk its body. If you command it to attack, attempt a spell attack roll against the target’s AC, dealing 1d10 [cold](link_trait_1519) damage on a hit (or double damage on a critical hit). This attack uses and contributes to your multiple attack penalty.

If you command the shadow to stalk, attempt a spell attack roll against the target’s AC the first time the target uses a [manipulate](link_trait_1433) action or a [move](link_trait_1505) action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a [move](link_trait_1505) action it’s using; if the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a [manipulate](link_trait_1433) or [move](link_trait_1505) action, the shadow disrupts that action.

Each time you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell, you can choose to either attack the target or command the shadow to stalk the target until the end of your next turn.

text.text: The [cold](link_trait_1519) damage is increased by 1d10.

name: Remix
description: You remix the Song of the Spheres into a catchy dance beat. The target becomes quickened and can use the extra action to [Interact](link_action_19733), [Stride](link_action_19855), or [Step](link_action_19853).

text.text: You can target up to 6 bonded creatures.

name: Shuffle Repeat
description: You shuffle the cosmic mix to repeat one creature’s personal anthem, further motivating and empowering them. The target’s [Strikes](link_action_19856) deal an additional die of [sonic](link_trait_1484) damage and the target gains a +1 status bonus to Will saves and Will DCs.

name: Vitality Nova
cost: any (minimum 2)
description:
You release a burst of condensed [vitality](link_trait_1478) energy, causing a radiant explosion of [healing](link_trait_1442) light. _Vitality nova_ heals all creatures in the area 1 Hit Point for every 2 Hit Points spent to [cast](link_action_19611) it. Treat this [healing](link_trait_1442) as a use of [Transfer Vitality](link_feat_34876).

*   If you spend 20 or more Hit Points and the spell was [cast](link_action_19611) in an area of [magical](link_trait_1504) [darkness](link_trait_1900), _vitality nova_ attempts to [counteract](link_action_27519) the [darkness](link_trait_1900) effect.
    
*   If you spend 40 or more Hit Points, creatures healed by the spell can attempt a DC 10 flat check to end persistent bleed damage.
    
*   If you spend 60 more Hit Points, end all persistent damage on creatures healed by this spell.

name: Vital Rebirth
cost: Twice the level of the target
trigger: A bonded creature within range would die.
description: Your network catches the soul of a bonded creature before it departs and forcefully resuscitates their body with a jolt of energy. You prevent the target from dying and restore a number of Hit Points to the target equal to twice its level. The target becomes immune to _vital rebirth_ for 24 hours. _Vital rebirth_ has no effect if the triggering effect was [_disintegrate_](link_spell_4571), [_promession_](link_spell_6908), or a [death](link_trait_1904) effect.

name: Wild Bond
description:
You tap into [primal](link_trait_1454) magic to infuse the target with the essence of another living creature and grant them one of the following abilities:

*   A burrow Speed of 15 feet.
    
*   A climb Speed of 20 feet.
    
*   A fly Speed of 20 feet.
    
*   A swim Speed of 25 feet.
    
*   A Speed of 40 feet.
    
*   A jaw [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack that deals 1d8 piercing damage
    
*   A claw [unarmed](link_trait_2398) attack that deals 1d6 slashing damage and has the [agile](link_trait_1569) and [finesse](link_trait_1570) traits
    
*   [Darkvision](link_sense_20769)

text.text: The damage dealt by the attacks increases to two dice.
Increase the number of targets to 5 targets. The damage dealt by the attacks increases to two dice.
Increase the number of targets to 5 targets. The damage dealt by the attacks increases to three dice.
Increase the number of targets to 5 targets. The damage dealt by the attacks increases to four dice.

name: Accelerate
description: You speed up the flow of your personal timeline in relation to the rest of the universe. You gain the quickened condition and can use the extra action each round only to [Strike](link_action_19856), [Stride](link_action_19855), or [Step](link_action_19853).

name: Alternate Outcome
trigger: A creature in your quantum field would succeed (but not critically succeed) a saving throw.
description: You reject the outcome in your current existence and replace it with that of a different reality. The target must reroll the triggering saving throw and use the worse result.

name: Parallel Forms
description: You split yourself into two versions with different fates. Each version of you [Strides](link_action_19855) from your current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they must target a different creature and use the same multiple attack penalty, counting as one attack toward your multiple attack penalty. Each round you [Sustain](link_action_19858) the spell, your parallel forms share actions and use the same bonuses and penalties, including your multiple attack penalty. You apply damage dealt to either form to your current Hit Points, but if both forms take damage from the same effect such as from an attack or spell with area damage, you only apply the damage once. In the case of an effect with a save that affects both forms, you take the worse result and apply it to both forms. When the spell ends, you choose one of the two forms as your actual form and the other version of you disappears. The spell automatically ends if you are reduced to 0 Hit Points.

text.text: Your parallel forms are quickened and can use the extra action to [Step](link_action_19853), [Stride](link_action_19855), or [Strike](link_action_19856).

name: Quantum Analysis
description:
You see the probability equations all around you, and trace each variable to every possible conclusion. Creatures you target can’t benefit from circumstance bonuses to AC due to cover against your attacks. You also ignore circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the creature being concealed, hidden, or behind cover. You can [cast](link_action_19611) spells that target creatures within your quantum field even if you don’t have line of sight to them.

The first time after [casting](link_action_19611) this spell when you make an attack roll against a creature within your quantum field during _quantum analysis_’ duration, you roll twice and use the better result. This effect has the [fortune](link_trait_1460) trait.

name: Reality Wipe
description:
You reset reality within your quantum field, purging the area of data. All written information and computer data in the area is subject to the effects of [_delete_](link_spell_6837). You attempt to [counteract](link_action_27519) any spell whose area or targets are in your quantum field, as [_dispel magic_](link_spell_4572). If the [counteract](link_action_27519) attempt succeeds, it prevents only the portion of the spell inside your quantum field (so if the spell also has targets outside your [aura](link_trait_1492), or part of its area is beyond your [aura](link_trait_1492), those targets or that area are affected normally).

Creatures in your quantum field take 8d6 [spirit](link_trait_1556) damage (basic Will save). Creatures who critically fail are stupefied 2 for 1 minute.

name: Time Loop
description:
You trap a creature in a time loop of your creation. The target sees and reacts to a repeating loop of events, based on the result of a Will save.

**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

**Success** The creature is stunned 1.

**Failure** The creature is stunned 2.

**Critical Failure** The creature is stunned 3 and slowed 1 for 1 minute.

name: Warp Presence
trigger: An enemy targets you with a Strike or spell attack.
description:
Your presence flickers in the target’s mind as though you had disappeared. The creature attempts a Will save.

**Success** You become concealed against that creature’s attacks for 1 round, including the triggering attack. If you were already concealed, you become undetected instead.

**Failure** The triggering attack misses. You are undetected to the triggering creature for 1 round. If you use a hostile action, this effect ends after that hostile action is completed.

**Critical Failure** The triggering attack misses. You are undetected to that creature for 1 minute. If you use a hostile action, this effect ends after that hostile action is completed.

name: Warp Probability
trigger: You fail an attack roll or saving throw.
description: You open your mind to read the underlying probability of the multiverse. Reroll the failed check and take the better result.

name: Warp Terrain
description:
You materialize terrain features from another reality over the effect of your quantum field. Choose one of the following effects, which lasts as long as your quantum field remains active, until you cast _warp terrain_ again, or you dismiss this spell.

*   You cause the area of your quantum field to become difficult terrain. You determine the appearance of the warped terrain. You and your allies can move through warped terrain normally and can [Take Cover](link_action_19860) using its features.
    
*   You suppress terrain in your field, turning any existing difficult or greater difficult terrain in your quantum field to become normal terrain. This does not apply to effects that cause a creature to count squares as difficult terrain (such as a [solarian](link_class_133)’s graviton-attunement attacks). If you’re attempting to suppress terrain created by a spell or other [magical](link_trait_1504) effect, you must successfully [counteract](link_action_27519) the effect.

text.text: You can choose to have the quantum field fill with fog, smoke, or another phenomenon that obscures vision. This functions as [_mist_](link_spell_4728).
You can choose to have the quantum field become greater difficult terrain instead of difficult terrain.

name: Warp Time
description:
You temporarily alter the timeline within your quantum field. Choose one of the following effects.

*   **Rewind** You rewind your personal timeline to an earlier point in your life cycle. You gain 10 temporary Hit Points, which last for 1 minute.
    
*   **Fast Forward** You accelerate the personal timeline of a creature in your quantum field to the end of its natural life cycle. The creature takes 1d10 [void](link_trait_1485) damage with a Fortitude save.
    
    **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
    
    **Success** The target takes half damage.
    
    **Failure** The target takes full damage and is enfeebled 1.
    
    **Critical Failure** The target takes double damage and is enfeebled 1 for 1 minute.
